snippet: The proposals would lighten a burden for many New Yorkers wading through the bureaucratic labyrinths of employment applications and pension benefits, among others.
abstract: Twin proposals introduced by New York City Council and Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration would allow New Yorkers to amend their gender identity on birth certificate so long as qualified professional signs off; officials and advocates say policy will be among most progressive for transgender rights in the country, allowing a person's own identity, not anatomy, to be determining factor.
lead_paragraph: The proposals would lighten a burden for many New Yorkers wading through the bureaucratic labyrinths of employment applications and pension benefits, among others.

headline.main: Easing the Law for New Yorkers Shifting Gender
headline.print_headline: Easing the Law for New Yorkers Shifting Gender
